page.title: 07St Nicholas JMI Sch. Norton
page.content: This school is a Church of England school it stands on the corner of Norton Road and Church Lane. It was built with a school house in 1872 and cost Â£800 with large donations from Messrs Pym and Cotton Brown.There was room for 80 children drawn from Norton and Radwell. In 1959 the school was modernised. The original school was made into an assembly hall and dining room. Four new classrooms were built. In 1972 a staffroom, two classrooms and toilets were added. In 1975 a nursery was built. There is a tarmac playground on the south side of the school with a large grassed area for playing. This extends to the Baldock footpath with further borders at Church Lane and Norton Hall Farm.The school takes 180 and there are 169 children on roll at present.
